results.title: The Escort = La Scorta
results.creator_credit: Ricky Tognazzi, Claudio Bonivento and Claudio Bonivento Productions
results.brief_description: La Scorta is the rivetting story of a judge and the four carbinieri officers assigned to protect him and their attempts to fight corruption in Sicily. The film opens with the violent death of a judge and his escort. Judge Michele de Francesco (Carlo Cecchi) volunteers as his replacement and soon discovers that corruption has infiltrated all levels of the community. Soon he finds that the only people he can trust are the four men assigned as his bodyguards, Angelo Mandelosi (Claudio Amendola), Andrea Corsale (Enrico Lo Verso), Fabio Muzzi (Ricky Memphis) and Raffaele Frasca (Tony Sperandeo). The five men risk their lives and the safety of their families in order to fight corruption in the Sicilian town. Ricky Tognazzi directs a seat-gripping thriller which comments on corruption in modern Italian society. With a musical score by Ennio Morricone. In Italian with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ricky Tognazzi, Claudio Bonivento and Claudio Bonivento Productions

results.title: The Whistle blower
results.creator_credit: Simon Langton, Geoffrey Reeve and Portreeve
results.brief_description: Nigel Havers plays a Russian linguist employed by an English spy centre to intercept and interpret KGB phone conversations. His father, portrayed by Michael Caine, is a conservative businessman and former intelligence officer whose faith in England is shattered after he uncovers the intricate web of deceit and cover-up employed by his country’s secret services. Following leads left by his son, he sets out to investigate the tactics and activities of the intelligence networks and the identity of the people they protect. Also stars James Fox, Felicity Deans, Sir John Gielgud, Kenneth Colley, Gordon Jackson, David Langton and Barry Foster. Screenplay by Julian Bond, based on the novel by John Hale. Photography by Fred Tammes. Edited by Robert Morgan. Music composed and conducted by John Scott, performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: A Son is born
results.creator_credit: Eric Porter and Eric Porter Studios
results.brief_description: This family melodrama, a tale of desertion, vengeful seduction, coincidental meeting and catharsis, spans more than two decades from 1920 to World War II. A woman imprisoned in a loveless marriage finds the courage to leave her husband but is disturbed to find that her son, David, refuses to go with her. She does not give up on him and manages to establish a new life for herself. Her world is turned upside down when David reluctantly moves in with her, determined to ruin their lives. Set against the backdrop of the Second World War, David is about to be sent to New Guinea which may make or break any future relationship he has with the people who love him. A notable aspect of the film is a production design which belies the low budget. Cast includes Peter Finch, Arthur Higgins, Ron Randell and Muriel Steinbeck.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Warrnambool veterans]
results.brief_description: Fourteen veterans tell their stories, from the Australian Army, the Royal Australian Navy, and the Royal Australian Air Force. They share their memories from World War II, the Korean and Vietnam Wars and from the Australian home front. Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [St Arnaud Veterans]
results.brief_description: While many didn’t see active service, these ten veterans from St Arnaud count their time in the army as the most important part of their lives. Proud of their service, they tell of exciting adventures, adjusting to big changes and the friends they made along the way.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [St Arnaud Veterans]

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [September 2010]
results.brief_description: ACMI’s Digital Storytelling unit interviewed ten Victorian war veterans for their perspectives on life in the army, being involved in war in a different country and adjusting to life back in Australia. The personal experiences of these soldiers provide a moving memoir and a compelling historical account of Australia in wartime.
